title: The Double Crosser
features: A maverick entrepreneur Krish Thomas builds a billion-dollar business empire from nothing. Well, not exactly nothing. But only few knew of the demons that relentlessly drive him from within.In dubious alliance with a corrupt political fixer Walter, the businessman plans to steal a fortune from his own company - to keep a childhood promise to his dying friend.But then, a double-crosser starts exposing the secret deal.With his business empire at stake, and his very survival threatened, Krish must choose between two agonizing options - a long-cherished dream, or the girl he has secretly loved all his life."The Double Crosser" is a gripping tale of high drama and tense emotion. A roller-coaster adventure in big finance, rampant corruption, and shining idealism. A stark choice between friendship and love."The Double Crosser is about how far one will go, how much one is willing to give... to achieve a goal" - Sid Sinclair"Fast paced. Never a dull moment. And a stunning climax. Great story." - Raj Ramanathan"A page-turner that kept me enthralled, from start to finish." - CharleneEnjoy 'The Double Crosser' - a novel by Manny Gordon.
description: Melbournian boy turned Indian writer, Manny Gordon lives in Chennai with his French wife and two young boys. During the day, Manny clocks time in a cubicle, pretending to code software for an IT firm. But in the twilight hours, while the world is fast asleep (or thinking about waking up), Manny entertains himself in the joyous universe of make believe. Larger than life characters. Crazier than impossible situations. King size dreams. Desperately dangerous risks. All are grist to Manny's imagination mill. His novels are about unconventional characters who lead zany lifestyles, becoming in a sense, a reflection of his own refusal to conform and fit in. Manny would love to hear from you, especially if you enjoy reading "The Double Crosser" and want to share your thoughts about this book. You'll find him on Facebook at: https://www.facebook.com/manny.gordon.1 Or visit his website at: http://www.TheDoubleCrosser.com
